intro: Droogmansia tisserantii, commonly known as the Tisserant's droogmansia, is a rare and unique plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiral-like arrangement of leaves that form a rosette. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
